intro: Myosotis arvensis subsp. arvensis, commonly known as the field forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. The species is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
